content: Ebola virus disease (Ebola, or EVD) is a severe, often fatal disease first detected in the Democratic Republic of the Congo in 1976. It is spread through contact with infected bodily fluids and has caused a large outbreak in West Africa. Nearly 10,000 people have been infected, with almost 5,000 deaths reported. WHO updates on EVD cases can be found at http://www.who.int/ebola. As of late October, nearly 10,000 people have contracted Ebola virus disease (EVD), with almost 5,000 deaths reported.
